Description: Basalt stele, some parts missing, with a Greek inscription inscribed in a single column within a clearly visible grid pattern. The inscription honours Damoxenos, a resident of Naukratis, as a proxenos and euergetes of the city of Lindos on Rhodes, and decreeing that the stele is to be set up in the Hellenion.
Curator's comments: The stele was first published by Pridik in 1908 and more recently in Hogjash and Berlev 1982. The text was finally established by Blinkenberg in 1941, and recently discussed in Bresson 2000. Given the Egyptian provenance, the date of the stele and fact that it relates to Rhodes, which is known to have had a stake in the Hellenion at Naukratis, the Ellanion mentioned in the text is most likely the Hellenion of Naukratis. E. Pridik 1908, 'Greek inscriptions in the collection of V.S. Golenitschev' (in Russian), Žurnal Ministerstva Narodnago Prosveščenija, Journal of the Ministry of Public Instruction, n.s. 13, 19-20, no.12. S. Hogjash, O. Berlev 1982, The Egyptian Reliefs and Stelae in the Pushkin Museum of Fine Arts, Moscow, Leningrad, no. 199. A. Bresson 2000, La cité marchande, 27-35. Chr. Lindos Blinkenberg 1941, Fouilles de l'Acropole 1902-1914. II Inscriptions, Copenhagen and Berlin, 212-4, appendix to no. 16.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (BA.07)
